text: The 1979 LPGA Championship was the 25th LPGA Championship, played June 7–10 at Jack Nicklaus Golf Center at Kings Island in Mason, Ohio, a suburb northeast of Cincinnati. Donna Caponi Young won the first of her two LPGA Championships, three strokes ahead of runner-up Jerilyn Britz. It was the third of her four major titles; her previous major win was nine years earlier. ==Past champions in the field== ===Made the cut=== {| class="wikitable" style="text- align:center" !Player || Country || Year won || R1 || R2 || R3 || R4 || Total || To par || Finish |- |align=left|Nancy Lopez || align=left| || 1978 || 73 || 71 || 69 || 76 || 289 || +1 || T10 |- | align=left|Sandra Post || align=left| || 1968 || 72 || 70 || 77 || 71 || 290 || +2 || T14 |- | align=left|Marlene Hagge || align=left| || 1956 || 74 || 75 || 71 || 72 || 292 || +4 || T21 |- |align=left|Kathy Ahern || align=left| || 1972 || 78 || 74 || 69 || 72 || 293 || +5 || T25 |- |align=left|Judy Kimball || align=left| || 1962 || 71 || 72 || 73 || 78 || 294 || +6 || T29 |- | align=left|Shirley Englehorn || align=left| || 1970 || 74 || 76 || 72 || 74 || 296 || +8 || T38 |- | align=left|Betty Burfeindt || align=left| || 1976 || 76 || 74 || 74 || 79 || 303 || +15 || T65 |- |} Source: ===Missed the cut=== {| class="wikitable" style="text- align:center" !Player || Country || Year(s) won || R1 || R2 || Total || To par |- | align=left|Kathy Whitworth || 67 71 75 align=left| || 1967, 1971, 1975 || 77 || 76 || 153 || +9 |- | align=left|Louise Suggs || align=left| || 1957 || 80 || 76 || 156 || +12 |} Source: ==Final leaderboard== Sunday, June 10, 1979 {|class="wikitable" !
